Legal_Issue: Can the applicants successfully challenge the refusal of their relatives' permanent residence applications under the Immigration Act and Regulations?
Governing_Law: The Immigration Act, 1976, and its Regulations
Burden_of_Proof: On applicants to demonstrate error or unfairness
Legal_Rule: Section 3(c) promotes family reunification but does not override other provisions; Regulation 7(3) requires assessment of ability to establish in Canada
Procedural_Issue: Alleged jurisdictional excess or failure to perform duty by respondents
Grounds_for_Claim: Refusal based on insufficient points, lack of validated employment, existing family ties in Vietnam
Outcome_on_Merits: No merit found in the application
Decision_Maker: Visa officers, court on judicial review
Review_Standard: Lawfulness of visa officer decisions under statutory framework
Key_Evidence_Considered: Schedule I factors, affidavits, application materials
Applicant_Challenge: Challenge to refusal of permanent residence applications
Defendant_Response: Visa officers acted lawfully within their authority
Remedy_Sought: Quashing of decision, mandatory order to reassess
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Failure to meet selection criteria: insufficient points, lack of validated employment
Applicable_Process: Permanent residence application and judicial review
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Right to reapply for permanent residence
Jurisdiction: Federal Court jurisdiction over immigration decisions
